org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.main

Class JsonSchemaFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.main.JsonSchemaFactory

  • public final class JsonSchemaFactory
extends Object
    Factory to build JSON Schema validating instances

    This class cannot be instantiated directly, you need to go through its included JsonSchemaFactory.Builder to do that. This is so that JsonSchema instances can be thread safe.

    Unless you have several sets of keywords, you will probably only ever need one of these. It caches syntax validation results and keyword validators to speed up validation (quite a bit).

    This class is thread safe.

    See Also:
    JsonSchema

      • getSchema

        public SchemaContainer getSchema(URI uri)
                          throws JsonSchemaException
        Get a schema container from a given URI

        This is the other way to obtain a container (the other is registerSchema(JsonNode)).

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI
        Returns:
        a schema container
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - cannot get schema from URI, or not a schema
        See Also:
        SchemaRegistry.get(URI)

      • getSchema

        public SchemaContainer getSchema(String str)
                          throws JsonSchemaException
        Get a schema container from a given URI

        This calls getSchema(URI) and uses URI.create(String) to build the URI

        Parameters:
        str - the URI as a string
        Returns:
        a schema container
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - cannot get schema from URI, or not a schema
        IllegalArgumentException - string is not a valid URI
        See Also:
        URI.create(String)

      • createSchema

        public JsonSchema createSchema(SchemaContainer container)
        Create a schema from a container

        This is one of the constructors you will use. The other is createSchema(SchemaContainer, String).

        Parameters:
        container - the schema container
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance

      • createSchema

        public JsonSchema createSchema(SchemaContainer container,
                      String path)
        Create a schema from a container, at a certain path

        For instance, if you register this schema:

             {
         "schema1": { ... },
         "schema2": { ... }
     }

        then you can create a validator for schema1 using:

             final JsonSchema schema = factory.create(container, "#/schema1");

        The path can be a JsonPointer as above, but also an id reference.

        Parameters:
        container - the schema container
        path - the pointer/id reference into the schema
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance

      • createSchema

        private JsonSchema createSchema(SchemaContainer container,
                      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode schema)
        Create a JsonSchema instance
        Parameters:
        container - the schema container
        schema - the subschema
        Returns:
